TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
26 Vita sancte Lucie uirginis.
SEinte lucie, þat holie Mayde &punctelev; In Cezile was ibore
&YOGH;ong heo bigan to serui god &punctelev; and bilefde sunne and hore
Dame Evtice hire Moder het &punctelev; þat hire to wommane brou&yogh;te
Of hire childe wel glad heo was &punctelev; ase heo suyþe wel ou&yogh;te
So bifeol þat on Dame Eutice cam a siknesse &punctelev; swiþe greuous and long
Four &yogh;er he[= heo] hadde gret pine— &punctelev; þe menison of blode wel strong
On leches heo hadde ispendet[MS. i spendedet] &punctelev; Muche del of hire guod
Ake þare nas non þat hire hele mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo ne bledde euere blod
So þat wide In þe londe Men tolden &punctelev; of seinte Agace
Of Miracles þat comen at hire schrine &punctelev; þoru ore louerdes grace
In þe cite of Cathenes &punctelev; þere þis holi womman lay
Folk wende þudere wel wide &punctelev; boþe Ni&yogh;t and day
bi manie scor togadere &punctelev; of eche londe aboute
Þo seinte lucie þis isai&yogh; &punctelev; al dai so gret route
"Moder," heo seide, "þou hauest an vuel &punctelev; ful greuous withalle
And we hereth of miracles al day &punctelev; þat of seinte Agace doth falle
go we þudere forth mid oþure &punctelev; to þe holie seint Agace
And þare þou schalt to hele come &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace."
¶ Nov was lucie stilleliche &punctelev; Itorned to cristinedom
Ake hire Moder heþene was &punctelev; and al þat heo of com
Lucie to ane heþene manne &punctelev; was iweddet In hire &yogh;onghede
Ake Naþeles clene Mayde heo was &punctelev; withoute eche fol dede
Hire Moder heo nam stilleliche &punctelev; and with oþere Men heo wende
To seinte Agace Toumbe &punctelev; hire Moder forto amende
[vv. 256 are tr. in the other MS.]And iheorde þe Masse a dai &punctelev; mid oþure þat þere were
Þo heo weren þudere icome— &punctelev; so longue[al. a stounde] heo lefden þere
So þat þe godspel was þat day &punctelev; ase lucie onderstod
Of a womman þat &yogh;wylene hadde &punctelev; þe menison of blod
And cam ant touchede þe lappe &punctelev; of ore louerdes cloþes ene
Ase he eode In grete prece &punctelev; and was hol anon and clene
"Leoue Moder," seide lucie &punctelev; "&yogh;if þov bileuest on holi churche
And þe wordes of þis godspel &punctelev; and þerafter wolt wurche
Þoru&yogh; touchingue of seinte Agace toumbe &punctelev; þou&yogh; schalt beo hol anon
Ase þeo womman &yogh;wylene was &punctelev; þat aftur ore louerd gan gon."
Þo þat folk was al iwent &punctelev; seinte lucie cam
To seinte Agace holie toumbe &punctelev; and ire Moder with hire nam
Þare heo leien In heore beden &punctelev; heo nolden þannes gon
¶ So þat lucie, þat clene Maide &punctelev; werth aslepe anon
Seinte Agace, þat holie Maide &punctelev; to hire fram heuene ali&yogh;te
With gret felau&yogh;schipe of Aungles— &punctelev; hire croune schon wel bri&yogh;te
"Lucie," heo seide, "leoue soster &punctelev; &yogh;wy trauaillestþou so
And &yogh;wy biddestþou me so &yogh;eorne þat þing &punctelev; þat þou mi&yogh;t þiself do
For þine bileue, þat is so guod &punctelev; helpez þi Moder, iwis
And nov þoru þe and þine guodnesse &punctelev; þi Moder iheld is
And also ase þis cite is &punctelev; iwuyrþet muche þoru&yogh; me
Also schal þi contreie &punctelev; Anoured beon for þe
For þi clene Maidenhod &punctelev; and for þi holie lif, iwis
Þi woneingue is wel &yogh;are imaket &punctelev; with us in heueneblis."
Þo þis holie Maide awok &punctelev; heo bigan to quakien sore
¶ "Moder," heo seide, "þov art hol &punctelev; ne þarfþe drede nonmore
For þe loue of þat holie Maide &punctelev; þat þe hath to hele ibrou&yogh;t
Ne fonde þov neuere to bringue me &punctelev; of mi clene þou&yogh;t
And ne soffre þou nou&yogh;t mine spouse in folie &punctelev; mi Maidenhod aspille
Ne lat me nou&yogh;t leose þat longue lif &punctelev; for a luytel fol wille
Ake al þat þou igrauntet hast &punctelev; forto &yogh;iue him with me
Lat me it &yogh;iue þe pouere men &punctelev; Moder, ich bidde þe."
Þe Moder, þo heo hol was &punctelev; guod womman bicam
And þe dou&yogh;ter bi hire Moder wille &punctelev; þat guod to hire heo nam
heo hit delte among pouere Men &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle þare ilaste ou&yogh;t
to him þat hire spouse was &punctelev; þe teoþingue was ibrou&yogh;t
he wende to seinte lucies norice &punctelev; and axede hire wel stille
&YOGH;wat lucie were on bicome &punctelev; heore guod forto aspille
¶ And &yogh;wi heo dude it so awei &punctelev; and &yogh;wodere heo dude it bere
Þis norice wel quoyntelich &punctelev; &yogh;af him anon answere
"heo hath ifounde forto sulle &punctelev; swyþe derewurþe þing, iwis
Þat is suych a þousent more wurth &punctelev; þanne al þat þing þat is
Þe beste chaffare it is ibou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat euere Man to drou&yogh;
Woldestþou gon þareInne In part &punctelev; riche man þou were inou&yogh;"
Þat was þe chaffare þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; þat heo hadde ibou&yogh;t
gret wonder he hadde of þulke Answere &punctelev; and stod in gret þou&yogh;t
So þat he onder&yogh;at sone &punctelev; þat heo cristine was
In grete wrathþe he tolde fore &punctelev; þe Iustice, þat het pakas.[MS. þakas]
Lucie was sone ifet &punctelev; and bifore þe Iustice ibrou&yogh;t
"Maide," seide þe Iustice &punctelev; "&yogh;wat hast þou iþou&yogh;t
¶ Let þi folie," he seide &punctelev; "Ich rede, on alle wiffe
And to ore godes, ase ri&yogh;t is &punctelev; do þine sacrefise!"
"Ich habbe," quath þis holie Maide &punctelev; "al þis þre &yogh;er ido
Mine sacrefise to Iesu crist &punctelev; and &yogh;uyt ichulle also
Al þat ich hadde ich habbe ispended &punctelev; and bitake In is lore
And þerto ichulle mi bodi take &punctelev; &yogh;wane me nis bileued nomore
Spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] ichulle nou al mi bodi &punctelev; fram þe fot to þe heued
And euerech lime In is seruise &punctelev; nov me nis more bileued
Ich &yogh;elde him op al mi bodi &punctelev; sire Iustise, here bifore þe
to spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] ech lime In is seruise— &punctelev; do &yogh;wat þou wolt bi me!"
¶ "Nov ich wot," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;wareto þou tornest þi mod
For In horedom and In lecherie &punctelev; þou hast ispend al þi guod
Þaron þou wolt þi bodi al spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; and þarof þou dest preche
&YOGH;wane þov nast non more to spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; forsoþe þou worst a wrechche
For þov spext ase an hore strong &punctelev; &yogh;wane þou wolt forsake
Þi louerd þat þou art to iweddet[corr. to iwedded.] &punctelev; and to lechours þe take."
"Iwedded ich was to Ihesu crist" &punctelev; þis holie maide him tolde
"Þo ich was ibaptized &punctelev; and þulke weddingue ichulle holde
Ake to horedome þov woldest me bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov me woldest make
Mine spousede louerd Ihesu crist &punctelev; for ani oþur man forsake."
"Þou schalt forsake him," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "haddestþou it iswore
For to þe commune bordel þov schalt beo &punctelev; ilad oþur ibore
[The following part of this legend is written as prose, in two columns on each page on f. 60b.]And þare schal mani a moderchild &punctelev; go to þi foule licame
And ligge bi þe, alle þat wollez &punctelev; in horedom and in schame."
¶ "Ne mai no wumman," quath þis maide &punctelev; "of hire maidenhod beo ido
For no dede þat men deth þe bodie &punctelev; bote ire herte beo[a later hand adds consente.] þerto
For þe more þat mi bodi a&yogh;ein mi wille &punctelev; here defouled is
Þe clenore[MS. clenore] is mi maydenhod &punctelev; and þe more mi mede, iwis."
¶ Þe Iustise let wide aboute &punctelev; into al þe contreie crie
Þat alle þat wolden &punctelev; bi a swuch fair wumman don anie folie
Comen to hire, alle þat wolden &punctelev; for alle heo scholde heom take,[a later hand adds consente.]
For in bordel heo scholde beo ido &punctelev; þare heo ne scholde non fursake
he hiet is men nimen hire faste &punctelev; and to þe bordel hire lede anon
Alle þat mi&yogh;hten nei&yogh;h hire come &punctelev; faste huy hire drowen echon
huy schoue and drowe al þat huy mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire anne fote iwinne
Ne o fote uchchen of þe stude &punctelev; þare as heo stod inne
Þo nomen huy ropes strongue inou&yogh; &punctelev; ant to fet and hondene teide
And alle þat mi&yogh;hten þere nei&yogh;h come &punctelev; faste huy drowen and breide
A þousend men with al heore main &punctelev; on hire gonne drawe
Ac euere heo lai stille a&yogh;ein &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "&YOGH;wat, hou goth þis?" quath þe iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;wat resun mai þis beo
Þat a þousend ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þis womman &punctelev; of þe stude enes teo?"
¶ "Sire iustise," þat Maide seide &punctelev; "þou hontest aboute nou&yogh;t
For, þei þou haddest &yogh;eot to heom &punctelev; ten þousend mo ibrou&yogh;t
&YOGH;uit it scholde biforen eov alle &punctelev; bi folfuld bi me her
Þat holie vers þat seint Dauid &punctelev; seithþ in þe sauter:[Ps. 90]
Þat a þousend men scholden in mi side falle &punctelev; and to grounde beon ibrou&yogh;t
And ten þousend in mi ri&yogh;ht side &punctelev; and nei&yogh;h me ne comen nou&yogh;t
Þarefore it is al for nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat þou hontest hereaboute
God is strengore þane þou be &punctelev; and þarefore inabbe no doute."
¶ "Þou art strong wichche," quath þe iustise &punctelev; "and þarof Man schal þe bringue
Mine clerkes and mine enchauntours &punctelev; binime schullen þi wich|chingue."
His clerkes he let bringue forth &punctelev; and his enchauntours echone
And huy maden heore coniurisones &punctelev; aboute þis Maide alone
And þo huy hadden al ido þat huy couþen &punctelev; þat folk gan eftsones drawe
Ake euere heo lai iliche stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ Þe Iustise, þo he þis isei&yogh; &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod
"Certes," he seide, "hire wichchingue &punctelev; ne schal do hire no guod."
Strongue temene he liet fette &punctelev; of Oxene mani on
And bringue þere þis Maide was &punctelev; and to hire tei&yogh;en echon
He liet heom prikie and harli faste &punctelev; and huy guonne drawe and pluchche
And euere lai þis Maide stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "Certes," he seide, "ore fare nis nou&yogh;t &punctelev; oþur&yogh;wat we moten do
With oþer þing we schullen hire to nau&yogh;te bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen so
Makieth ope þe hore, þare heo lijthþ &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen hire winne heonne
Also strong fuyr ase &yogh;e conne &punctelev; þat heo alto douste brenne!"
A strong fuir and gret inou&yogh; &punctelev; þis tormentores wrou&yogh;te
Aboute þis holie clene maide &punctelev; to brenne hire alto nou&yogh;te
Þo þis fuyr was wel strongue imaud &punctelev; heo sat amidde ful stille
Þat fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte don hire non harm &punctelev; þat were wurth a fille
Þo nomen huy pich and brumston &punctelev; and welden it wel faste
And ope hire nakede tendre bodi &punctelev; alfuyri it casten
¶ Euere sat þis Maide stille &punctelev; it ne greuede hire noþing
Ake euere heo prechede with glade heorte &punctelev; of Ihesu, heuene king
¶ Þo nuste þis luþere iustise &punctelev; &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;hte don more
&YOGH;wane he ne mi&yogh;hte þis clene þing &punctelev; ouercome mid al is lore
A scharp swerd and a kene &punctelev; þoru&yogh; hire þrote he liet do
To binimen hire speche &punctelev; and hire lijf also
Þo heo was þoru&yogh; þe þrote ismite &punctelev; þe betere heo spac inou&yogh;
And prechede euere of Ihesu crist &punctelev; and wel smere lou&yogh;
¶ "&YOGH;e þat beoth cristine &punctelev; glade and bliþe &yogh;e beo
Of noþing ne habbe &yogh;e drede &punctelev; for gret ioy ich iseo
Ane Ioyeful þyþingue ich eou telle &punctelev; þat sothþ is and nou&yogh;t les
Þat ri&yogh;ht nouþe is holi churche &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t in guod pes
For hire tweie wiþerwines &punctelev; þat habbez ibeo so &yogh;are
Ri&yogh;ht nouþe beoth to nau&yogh;t ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;e þorue habbe of heom no kare
For þe luþere dioclician &punctelev; þat so muche harm hath ido
he is ipult out of his kynedom &punctelev; he ne cometh nonmore þarto
And also Maximian &punctelev; þat so luþur hath ibeo
Ri&yogh;th nouþe he deide in luþur deth &punctelev; &yogh;e schulle him nonmore iseo
So þat þe luþere wiþerwines &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein holie churche were
Out of heore mi&yogh;hte beoth ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne habbe &yogh;e none fere
¶ Þus glade tyþingue ich eov bringue &punctelev; þei huy feor heonne beo
Ihered beo god, þat ich moste &punctelev; þis dai aliue iseo
Ichulle biteche ou ihesu crist &punctelev; for fram eov ich mot wende
Bringuth me ore louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; for þat schal beo mi[corr. to my] ende."
¶ Þe preostes wenden forth anon &punctelev; and folk þat þere stod
And fetten to þis holie maide &punctelev; godes fl[e]chs and is blod
Þo heo it hadde underfongue &punctelev; and hire ri&yogh;htes also
And þe oresones weren alle iseid &punctelev; þat bifullen þerto
Mid þe laste [word][om.] heo &yogh;af þene gost &punctelev; ase huy amen seide
Aungles þare weren redie Inowe &punctelev; hire soule to heuene lede
Þere heo is with ihesu crist &punctelev; in Ioye withouten ende
Nou god for seinte lucie loue &punctelev; þudere us late iwiende! Amen
